content: Upon returning from space missions, astronauts must declare any lunar material to which government agency?

Upon returning from space missions, astronauts must declare any lunar material to the United States government agency called NASA (National Aeronautics and Space Administration). This is because NASA is responsible for overseeing and regulating all aspects of space exploration and activities conducted by American astronauts. The agency ensures that all materials obtained during space missions are properly documented, analyzed, and preserved for scientific research and historical significance.
